remarks: Given two atoms not less than or equal to an element covered by 1, there is a third.  Lemma B in [Crawley] p. 112.  (Contributed by NM, 8-May-2012.)
statement:
cdlemb.b $e |- B = ( Base ` K ) $.
cdlemb.l $e |- .<_ = ( le ` K ) $.
cdlemb.j $e |- .\/ = ( join ` K ) $.
cdlemb.u $e |- .1. = ( 1. ` K ) $.
cdlemb.c $e |- C = ( <o ` K ) $.
cdlemb.a $e |- A = ( Atoms ` K ) $.
cdlemb $p |- ( ( ( K e. HL /\ P e. A /\ Q e. A ) /\ ( X e. B /\ P =/= Q ) /\ ( X C .1. /\ -. P .<_ X /\ -. Q .<_ X ) ) -> E. r e. A ( -. r .<_ X /\ -. r .<_ ( P .\/ Q ) ) ) $.
$d .1. r $.
$d .<_ r $.
$d .\/ r $.
$d A r $.
$d B r $.
$d C r $.
$d K r $.
$d P r $.
$d Q r $.
$d X r $.
